page.title: 02 HAVERHOLME PARK
page.content: Haverholme park is not as the name suggests a play park or an animal park,but is in actual fact a large agricultural land area.The land is used mainly for farming various types of arable crops.Running through the park is a river called the River SLEA. The nearest town to the park is called SLEAFORD,it being named after a fording place across the river.Many of the local children go to the park to swim in the river during their summer holidays.The park is owned by the Post Office Trust Fund.Near the park is an old priory that is suppossedly haunted by a nun .
